trans-unit.source: Draws an icon or cursor into the specified device context

seg-source.mrk: Draws an icon or cursor into the specified device context

target.mrk: Draws an icon or cursor into the specified device context

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle to the device context into which the icon or cursor is drawn

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the device context into which the icon or cursor is drawn

target.mrk: Handle to the device context into which the icon or cursor is drawn

trans-unit.source: X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the icon

seg-source.mrk: X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the icon

target.mrk: X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the icon

trans-unit.source: Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the icon

seg-source.mrk: Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the icon

target.mrk: Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the icon

trans-unit.source: Handle to the icon to be drawn

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the icon to be drawn

target.mrk: Handle to the icon to be drawn

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies the logical width of the icon or cursor.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Specifies the logical width of the icon or cursor.

target.mrk: [optional]
Specifies the logical width of the icon or cursor.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is zero and the $iFlags parameter is "default size", the function uses the $SM_CXICON or $SM_CXCURSOR system metric value to set the width.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is zero and the $iFlags parameter is "default size", the function uses the $SM_CXICON or $SM_CXCURSOR system metric value to set the width.

target.mrk: If this parameter is zero and the $iFlags parameter is "default size", the function uses the $SM_CXICON or $SM_CXCURSOR system metric value to set the width.

trans-unit.source: If this is zero and "default size" is not used, the function uses the actual resource width.

seg-source.mrk: If this is zero and "default size" is not used, the function uses the actual resource width.

target.mrk: If this is zero and "default size" is not used, the function uses the actual resource width.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies the logical height of the icon or cursor.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Specifies the logical height of the icon or cursor.

target.mrk: [optional]
Specifies the logical height of the icon or cursor.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is zero and the $iFlags parameter is "default size", the function uses the $SM_CYICON or $SM_CYCURSOR system metric value to set the width.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is zero and the $iFlags parameter is "default size", the function uses the $SM_CYICON or $SM_CYCURSOR system metric value to set the width.

target.mrk: If this parameter is zero and the $iFlags parameter is "default size", the function uses the $SM_CYICON or $SM_CYCURSOR system metric value to set the width.

trans-unit.source: If this is zero and "default size" is not used, the function uses the actual resource height.

seg-source.mrk: If this is zero and "default size" is not used, the function uses the actual resource height.

target.mrk: If this is zero and "default size" is not used, the function uses the actual resource height.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies the index of the frame to draw if $hIcon identifies an animated cursor.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Specifies the index of the frame to draw if $hIcon identifies an animated cursor.

target.mrk: [optional]
Specifies the index of the frame to draw if $hIcon identifies an animated cursor.

trans-unit.source: This parameter is ignored if $hIcon does not identify an animated cursor.

seg-source.mrk: This parameter is ignored if $hIcon does not identify an animated cursor.

target.mrk: This parameter is ignored if $hIcon does not identify an animated cursor.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Handle to a brush that the system uses for flicker-free drawing.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Handle to a brush that the system uses for flicker-free drawing.

target.mrk: [optional]
Handle to a brush that the system uses for flicker-free drawing.

trans-unit.source: If $hBrush is a valid brush handle, the system creates an offscreen bitmap using the specified brush for the background color, draws the icon or cursor into the bitmap, and then copies the bitmap into the device context identified by $hDC.

seg-source.mrk: If $hBrush is a valid brush handle, the system creates an offscreen bitmap using the specified brush for the background color, draws the icon or cursor into the bitmap, and then copies the bitmap into the device context identified by $hDC.

target.mrk: If $hBrush is a valid brush handle, the system creates an offscreen bitmap using the specified brush for the background color, draws the icon or cursor into the bitmap, and then copies the bitmap into the device context identified by $hDC.

trans-unit.source: If $hBrush is 0, the system draws the icon or cursor directly into the device context.

seg-source.mrk: If $hBrush is 0, the system draws the icon or cursor directly into the device context.

target.mrk: If $hBrush is 0, the system draws the icon or cursor directly into the device context.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies the drawing flags. This parameter can be one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Specifies the drawing flags.
This parameter can be one of the following values:

target.mrk: [optional]
Specifies the drawing flags.
This parameter can be one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: 1 - Draws the icon or cursor using the mask

seg-source.mrk: 1 - Draws the icon or cursor using the mask

target.mrk: 1 - Draws the icon or cursor using the mask

trans-unit.source: 2 - Draws the icon or cursor using the image

seg-source.mrk: 2 - Draws the icon or cursor using the image

target.mrk: 2 - Draws the icon or cursor using the image

trans-unit.source: 3 - Draws the icon or cursor using the mask and image

seg-source.mrk: 3 - Draws the icon or cursor using the mask and image

target.mrk: 3 - Draws the icon or cursor using the mask and image

trans-unit.source: 4 - Draws the icon or cursor using the system default image rather than the user-specified image

seg-source.mrk: 4 - Draws the icon or cursor using the system default image rather than the user-specified image

target.mrk: 4 - Draws the icon or cursor using the system default image rather than the user-specified image

trans-unit.source: 5 - Draws the icon or cursor using the width and height specified by the system metric values for cursors or icons, if the width and height parameters are set to zero.

seg-source.mrk: 5 - Draws the icon or cursor using the width and height specified by the system metric values for cursors or icons, if the width and height parameters are set to zero.

target.mrk: 5 - Draws the icon or cursor using the width and height specified by the system metric values for cursors or icons, if the width and height parameters are set to zero.

trans-unit.source: If this flag is not specified and width and height are set to zero, the function uses the actual resource size.

seg-source.mrk: If this flag is not specified and width and height are set to zero, the function uses the actual resource size.

target.mrk: If this flag is not specified and width and height are set to zero, the function uses the actual resource size.

trans-unit.source: 6 - Draws the icon as an unmirrored icon

seg-source.mrk: 6 - Draws the icon as an unmirrored icon

target.mrk: 6 - Draws the icon as an unmirrored icon

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: True

seg-source.mrk: True

target.mrk: True

trans-unit.source: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

seg-source.mrk: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

target.mrk: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information
